alert.note: Alert for Overton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 2:48AM CDT until April 01 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN OVERTON...NORTHERN CUMBERLAND...SOUTHEASTERN PUTNAM AND SOUTHWESTERN FENTRESS COUNTIES... At 247 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Monterey, or 13 miles northwest of Crossville, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Crossville, Fairfield Glade, Monterey, Pleasant Hill, Slate Springs and Clarkrange. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 300 and 317. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
